t: Joy in the Salvation of the Lord
To the Chief Musician. A Psalm of David.
The*pn king shall have joy in Your strength, O Lord;*s And*ld in Your salvation how greatly shall he rejoice!
You*ld have given him his heart’s desire, And*ld have not withheld the request of his lips. Selah*ipg
For*pn You meet him with the blessings of goodness; You*ld set a crown of pure gold upon his head.
He*ld asked life from You, and*i You gave it*i to him— Length*ld of days forever and ever.
His*ld glory is*i great in Your salvation; Honor*ld and majesty You have placed upon him.
For*ld You have made him most blessed forever; You*ld have made him exceedingly glad with Your presence.
For*ld the king trusts in the Lord,*s And*ld through the mercy of the Most High he shall not be moved.
Your*ln hand will find all Your enemies; Your*ld right hand will find those who hate You.
You*ld shall make them as a fiery oven in the time of Your anger; The*ld Lord*s shall swallow them up in His wrath, And*ld the fire shall devour them.
Their*ld offspring You shall destroy from the earth, And*ld their descendants from among the sons of men.
For*ld they intended evil against You; They*ld devised a plot which*i they are not able to*i perform.
Therefore*ld You will make them turn their back; You*ld will make ready Your*i arrows*i on Your string toward their faces.
Be*ln exalted, O Lord,*s in Your own strength! We*ld will sing and praise Your power.
